Finding a Need in Streaming

Gaming Category

Why do people watch gaming streams? What are their needs?

Scroll down

Game Streaming

What exactly is it?

Streaming is being the transfer of data (such as audio or video material) in a continuous stream especially for immediate processing or playback without the need to download it first. Game streaming is transmitting the screen of a video game along with a video of the player to a live audience.

Where can we listen or watch streams?

Webites Public &
Accessible
Apps Private and
Public Streams

Types of Streams and Platforms

Where do people access gaming streams?

There are various platforms used in streaming. Audio streaming platforms there are Spotify, iTunes and Deezer. Video streaming platforms, YouTube, Netflix, Facebook. Live streaming, Twitch, Facebook Live, Instagram Live, Twitter Spaces, Vlive.

Types of Streamed Content

Video Games

What is a Good Gaming Stream?

Chracteristics
As a Streamer,
Qualities

Keep your Audience Engaged

Keeping a conversation flowing goes a long way in keeping your audience engaged

Be Creative

Being creative in your streams and how you present it. Viewers like it when they see something eye-catching.

Use Social Networks

Using social networks can help you connect more with your viewers and let them get to know you more.

Honesty

Being honest at all times even during streams is a must. We make sure the streamer we are watching does not promote false information.

Respect and Consistency

Respect should be practiced because streaming should be a safe space for everyone. Consistency is to show the audience how consistent you are with your goal in the stream.

Need of Viewers

Why Do People Watch Gaming Streams?

To Relieve
Stress

View More

Streams Serve as Their Stress Relievers

  • People find comfort in watching their favorite streamer.

  • Whether it was a stressful or normal day, viewers find themselves watching stress to calm their nerves.

  • Some streams have a cool and calm ambiance and some viewers long for that.

Improve and
Learn New Skills

View More

They Watch Streams to Improve Gaming Skills

  • Viewers watch gaming streams in order to improve their gaming capabilities in a game.

  • People run to watch streamers to know their gameplay and learn from them.

For
Entertainment

View More

People Watch Streams for Entertainment and
to Fight Boredom

  • One of the most important things is the streamer's personality. If viewers like the streamer's personality, they get entertained and can't get enough.

  • They get entertained because its almost liek one is watching a reality TV show.

They Feel Connected
to a Community

View More

They Feel Like they are in a Community

  • Aside from plainly watching the streamer, fanbase can be someone a streamer can connect with.

  • Since streams are like interactions, viewers get to interact and they would feel a sense of belonging or connection with the people who have same interests as them.

Viewer Analysis

Who are These Audiences that Watch Gaming Streams?

With the eSports industry becoming an increasingly important part of the entertainment sector, players get to compete with each other individually or in teams. According to a survey conducted by statista.com , ages around 16-64 years old watch live streams of video games worldwide, as of July 2019.

Worldwide, the Philippines has the highest number of people who watch these gaming live streams (49%). Followed by Indonesia (40%), India (39%), China (38%), Thailand (37%). Along with Switzerland (8%) being the lowest.
